column1: Common sugars include: - Glucose - Fructose - Galactose - Sucrose (common table sugar) - Lactose (milk sugar) - Maltose (product of starch digestion) Sugars are found naturally in milk products (lactose) and fruits (fructose).
Sucrose (table sugar): - Sucrose is made from a low-sugar beet juice or sugar cane.
- Confectioner's sugar (also known as powdered sugar) is finely ground sucrose.
- These sweeteners are used as an ingredient in many food products that are labeled "sugar-free", "diabetic", or "low carb".
These sweeteners are absorbed by the body at a much slower rate than sugar.
Sugar alcohol may cause stomach cramps and diarrhea in some people.
- Erythritol is a naturally occurring sugar alcohol found in fruit and fermented foods.
Unlike other sugar alcohols, it does not cause stomach upset.
Other types of natural sugars: - Dextrose is glucose combined with water.
- Lactose (milk sugar) is the carbohydrate that is in milk.
- Maltose (malt sugar) is produced during fermentation.
- Maple sugar comes from the sap of maple trees.
Sugar and other sweeteners with calories can lead to tooth decay.
Large amounts of sugar-containing foods lead to obesity in children and adults.
Sugar alcohols such as sorbitol, mannitol, and xylitol may cause stomach cramps and diarrhea when eaten in large amounts.
- Eat less candy and sweet desserts such as ice cream, cookies, and cakes.
If you have diabetes: - Sugars affect blood glucose control the same as other carbohydrates when eaten at meals or snacks.
- Foods that contain sugar alcohols may have fewer calories, but be sure to read the labels for the carbohydrate content of these foods.
